[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@rushstack/terminal](./terminal.md) &gt; [AnsiEscape](./terminal.ansiescape.md)

## AnsiEscape class

Operations for working with text strings that contain [ANSI escape codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANSI_escape_code)<></>. The most commonly used escape codes set the foreground/background color for console output.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class AnsiEscape 
```

<table><thead><tr><th>

Method


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[formatForTests(text, options)](./terminal.ansiescape.formatfortests.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Replaces ANSI escape codes with human-readable tokens. This is useful for unit tests that compare text strings in test assertions or snapshot files.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[getEscapeSequenceForAnsiCode(code)](./terminal.ansiescape.getescapesequenceforansicode.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[removeCodes(text)](./terminal.ansiescape.removecodes.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Returns the input text with all ANSI escape codes removed. For example, this is useful when saving colorized console output to a log file.


</td></tr>
